ExecutableTestSuite.label: Conformance class: Information accessibility, Environmental Monitoring Facilities
ExecutableTestSuite.description:
This test suite examines a data set against the themespecific requirements related to the accessibility of resources referenced by the data.

This is a draft version. It has limitations and is expected to contain errors. Please report any issues or problems in GitHub.

Known limitations are documented in the description of the applicable test case or test assertion. There is a general limitation in all assertions that extensions in additional application schemas are only supported, if the unqualified name of the feature type in the extension is the same as the name of the feature type in the INSPIRE application schema.

Source: Conformance Class 'Information accessibility, Environmental Monitoring Facilities'

Pre-requisite conformance classes:
  • Conformance Class 'Information accessibility'
ExecutableTestSuite.author: Consortium Bilbomatica, Guadaltel y Geograma

ParameterList.name: ETF Standard Parameters for XML test objects

TestCase.label: Code lists
TestCase.description: Verify that code lists extensions can be accessed.

TestAssertion.label: ef-ia.a.1: MeasurementRegimeValue
TestAssertion.description:
Verify that any code list extensions are publicly accessible via HTTP, i.e. inspect extensible code list valued property elements. If a reference (@xlink:href) has a value that does not start with http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/, verify that a HTTP GET request to the URI retrieves a document.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (3): Code Lists and Enumerations. Where, for an attribute whose type is a code list as referred to in points (b), (c) or (d) of paragraph 1, a data provider provides a value that is not specified in this Regulation, that value and its definition shall be made available in a register.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Code lists', INSPIRE Data Specification on Environmental Monitoring Facilities, A.6.1
TestAssertion.expression:
let $features_selected := $features[self::ef:EnvironmentalMonitoringFacility] let $property_string := 'MeasurementRegimeValue' let $messages := for $feature in $features_selected let $envDom := $feature/ef:measurementRegime let $urls := for $x in $envDom/@xlink:href return if (starts-with($x, 'http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/')) then () else $x let $map := local:check-resource-uris($urls, 30, true()) let $invalid_urls := for $href in $urls let $url := string($href) let $validuri := map:get($map, $url) return if ($validuri = 'notHTTP' or starts-with($validuri, 'EXCEPTION') or $validuri = 'idNotFound' or matches($validuri,'^\d{3}$')) then $url else ()
return if (not(exists($feature/ef:measurementRegime))) then local:addMessage('TR.missingElementEnvironmentalFacilities', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string}) else if (count($feature/ef:measurementRegime) > 1) then local:addMessage('TR.wrongMultiplicityEnvironmentalFacilities', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'multiplicity': 1, 'count': count($feature/ef:measurementRegime)}) else if(count($invalid_urls) > 0) then local:addMessage('TR.brokenLinkEnvironmentalFacilities', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string($envDom/@xlink:href)}) else () return (if ($messages) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $messages)

TestAssertion.label: ef-ia.a.2: MediaMonitoredValue
TestAssertion.description:
Verify that any code list extensions are publicly accessible via HTTP, i.e. inspect extensible code list valued property elements. If a reference (@xlink:href) has a value that does not start with http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/, verify that a HTTP GET request to the URI retrieves a document.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (3): Code Lists and Enumerations. Where, for an attribute whose type is a code list as referred to in points (b), (c) or (d) of paragraph 1, a data provider provides a value that is not specified in this Regulation, that value and its definition shall be made available in a register.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Code lists', INSPIRE Data Specification on Environmental Monitoring Facilities, A.6.1
TestAssertion.expression:
let $features_selected := $features[self::ef:EnvironmentalMonitoringFacility | self::ef:EnvironmentalMonitoringNetwork | self::ef:EnvironmentalMonitoringProgramme] let $property_string := 'MediaMonitoredValue' let $messages := for $feature in $features_selected let $envDom := $feature/ef:mediaMonitored let $urls := for $x in $envDom/@xlink:href return if (starts-with($x, 'http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/')) then () else $x let $map := local:check-resource-uris($urls, 30, true()) let $invalid_urls := for $href in $urls let $url := string($href) let $validuri := map:get($map, $url) return if ($validuri = 'notHTTP' or starts-with($validuri, 'EXCEPTION') or $validuri = 'idNotFound' or matches($validuri,'^\d{3}$')) then $url else ()
return if (not(exists($feature/ef:mediaMonitored))) then local:addMessage('TR.missingElementEnvironmentalFacilities', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string}) else if (exists($feature/ef:mediaMonitored) and not(count($envDom) = count($envDom/@xlink:href))) then local:addMessage('TR.missingAttributeEnvironmentalFacilities', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'attribute': 'xlink:href'}) else if(count($invalid_urls) > 0) then local:addMessage('TR.brokenLinkEnvironmentalFacilities', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string($envDom/@xlink:href)}) else () return (if ($messages) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $messages)

Verify that any code list extensions are publicly accessible via HTTP, i.e. inspect extensible code list valued property elements. If a reference (@xlink:href) has a value that does not start with http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/, verify that a HTTP GET request to the URI retrieves a document.

Where, for an attribute whose type is a code list as referred to in points (b), (c) or (d) of paragraph 1, a data provider provides a value that is not specified in this Regulation, that value and its definition shall be made available in a register.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Code lists', INSPIRE Data Specification on Environmental Monitoring Facilities, A.6.1
TestAssertion.expression:
let $features_selected := $features[self::ef:ObservingCapability] let $property_string := 'ProcessTypeValue' let $messages := for $feature in $features_selected let $envDom := $feature/ef:processType let $urls := for $x in $envDom/@xlink:href return if (starts-with($x, 'http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/')) then () else $x let $map := local:check-resource-uris($urls, 30, true()) let $invalid_urls := for $href in $urls let $url := string($href) let $validuri := map:get($map, $url) return if ($validuri = 'notHTTP' or starts-with($validuri, 'EXCEPTION') or $validuri = 'idNotFound' or matches($validuri,'^\d{3}$')) then $url else ()
return if (not(exists($feature/ef:processType))) then local:addMessage('TR.missingElementEnvironmentalFacilities', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string}) else if (count($feature/ef:processType) > 1) then local:addMessage('TR.wrongMultiplicityEnvironmentalFacilities', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'multiplicity': 1, 'count': count($feature/ef:processType)}) else if(count($invalid_urls) > 0) then local:addMessage('TR.brokenLinkEnvironmentalFacilities', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string($envDom/@xlink:href)}) else () return (if ($messages) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $messages)

TestAssertion.label: ef-ia.a.4: PurposeOfCollectionValue
TestAssertion.description:
Verify that any code list extensions are publicly accessible via HTTP, i.e. inspect extensible code list valued property elements. If a reference (@xlink:href) has a value that does not start with http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/, verify that a HTTP GET request to the URI retrieves a document.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (3): Code Lists and Enumerations. Where, for an attribute whose type is a code list as referred to in points (b), (c) or (d) of paragraph 1, a data provider provides a value that is not specified in this Regulation, that value and its definition shall be made available in a register.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Code lists', INSPIRE Data Specification on Environmental Monitoring Facilities, A.6.1
TestAssertion.expression:
let $features_selected := $features[self::ef:EnvironmentalMonitoringFacility | self::ef:EnvironmentalMonitoringNetwork | self::ef:EnvironmentalMonitoringProgramme] let $property_string := 'PurposeOfCollectionValue' let $messages := for $feature in $features_selected let $envDom := $feature/ef:purpose let $urls := for $x in $envDom/@xlink:href return if (starts-with($x, 'http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/')) then () else $x let $map := local:check-resource-uris($urls, 30, true()) let $invalid_urls := for $href in $urls let $url := string($href) let $validuri := map:get($map, $url) return if ($validuri = 'notHTTP' or starts-with($validuri, 'EXCEPTION') or $validuri = 'idNotFound' or matches($validuri,'^\d{3}$')) then $url else ()
return if(count($invalid_urls) > 0) then local:addMessage('TR.brokenLinkEnvironmentalFacilities', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string($envDom/@xlink:href)}) else () return (if ($messages) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $messages)

TestAssertion.label: ef-ia.a.7: SpecialisedEMFTypeValue
TestAssertion.description:
Verify that any code list extensions are publicly accessible via HTTP, i.e. inspect extensible code list valued property elements. If a reference (@xlink:href) has a value that does not start with http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/, verify that a HTTP GET request to the URI retrieves a document.

Relevant requirements:
  • IR Requirement Article 6 (3): Code Lists and Enumerations. Where, for an attribute whose type is a code list as referred to in points (b), (c) or (d) of paragraph 1, a data provider provides a value that is not specified in this Regulation, that value and its definition shall be made available in a register.
Source: Abstract Test Case 'Code lists', INSPIRE Data Specification on Environmental Monitoring Facilities, A.6.1
TestAssertion.expression:
let $features_selected := $features[self::ef:EnvironmentalMonitoringFacility] let $property_string := 'SpecialisedEMFTypeValue' let $messages := for $feature in $features_selected let $envDom := $feature/ef:specialisedEMFType let $urls := for $x in $envDom/@xlink:href return if (starts-with($x, 'http://inspire.ec.europa.eu/codelist/')) then () else $x let $map := local:check-resource-uris($urls, 30, true()) let $invalid_urls := for $href in $urls let $url := string($href) let $validuri := map:get($map, $url) return if ($validuri = 'notHTTP' or starts-with($validuri, 'EXCEPTION') or $validuri = 'idNotFound' or matches($validuri,'^\d{3}$')) then $url else ()
return if (count($feature/ef:specialisedEMFType) > 1) then local:addMessage('TR.wrongMultiplicityEnvironmentalFacilities', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'multiplicity': '0 or 1', 'count': count($feature/ef:specialisedEMFType)}) else if(count($invalid_urls) > 0) then local:addMessage('TR.brokenLinkEnvironmentalFacilities', map {'filename': local:filename($feature), 'featureType':local-name($feature), 'gmlid': string($feature/@*:id), 'property': $property_string, 'value': string($envDom/@xlink:href)}) else () return (if ($messages) then 'FAILED' else 'PASSED', local:error-statistics('TR.recordsWithErrors', count(fn:distinct-values($messages//etf:argument[@token='id']/text()))), $messages)
